greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) read by rows: coefficients of polynomials P_n(t) defined in Formula section.
comment: "The series expansion of the solution counts skeleton vertex diagrams with dressed propagators and bare interactions." (see G^2v-skeleton expansion in Molinari link)
link: Luca G. Molinari, Nicola Manini, Enumeration of many-body skeleton diagrams, arXiv:cond-mat/0512342 [cond-mat.str-el], 2006.
formula: y(x;t) = Sum_{n>=0} P_n(t)*x^n satisfies 0 = 1 - (1 + 2*x*t)*y + x*(1 + 2*t + x*t^2)*y^2 + t*(1-t)*x^2*y^3 + 2*x^2*y*deriv(y,x), with y(0;t)=1, where P_n(t) = Sum_{k=0..n-1} T(n,k)*t^k for n>0.
mathematica: row[n_] := CoefficientList[Coefficient[y0[x, t], x, n], t];
Table[row[n], {n, 0, max - 1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 23 2017, adapted from PARI *)
results.author: _Gheorghe Coserea_, May 21 2017
